Method Detail

createAdaptor

public IBurstlyAdaptor createAdaptor(Map<String,?> createParams)
Description copied from interface: IAdaptorFactory
Creates a new adaptor instance.
There are three available parameters by default in params:
  • key - "context", value - Context instance of current context
  • key - "viewId", value - String view id of BurstlyView instance for which adaptor will be created
  • key - "adaptorName", value - String name of the adaptor to create, passed from the server in parameters. Generally IBurstlyAdaptor.getNetworkName() should return this value

Specified by:
createAdaptor in interface IAdaptorFactory
Parameters:
createParams - Map parameters needed to create an adaptor
Returns:
IBurstlyAdaptor instance

isSdkAvailable

protected boolean isSdkAvailable()
Checks whether underlying SDK implementation available.

Returns:
true if sdk implementation available

protected abstract IBurstlyAdaptor createInstance(Context context,
                                                  String viewId)
Implement to return valid adaptor implementation.

Parameters:
context - Context current context
viewId - String current view id
Returns:

destroy

public void destroy()
Description copied from interface: IAdaptorFactory
Destroys the factory. This method must perfrom a full cleanup. All background activities must be stopped. All resources must be freed. There is no guarantee for this method to be called.

Specified by:
destroy in interface IAdaptorFactory

initialize

public void initialize(Map<String,?> initParams)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: IAdaptorFactory
Initializes the ad network. This method is supposed to do all initialization heavy lifting for the network. There is just one instance of the factory per running application. This method is called only once during the factory construction.

Specified by:
initialize in interface IAdaptorFactory
Parameters:
initParams - Map parameters needed to initialize the factory
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException
